page.title: 19GOLDHANGER - THE NAME
page.content: The name "Goldhanger" has been spelt "Goldangre","Goldangra" and "Goldanger" before the present spelling,"Goldhanger". The "gold" part in the name Goldhanger" which is present in all the spellings comes from a flower - the corn marigold.It was used to cure diseases such as smallpox and measels but it was becoming a serious pest by the 12th century and so Henry II issued an ordinance against it. The "anger" part means either a hill or a grassland and since it is a flat area a grassland is more likely. Nearby towns and villages such as Ongar and Chipping Ongar are probably also related to a grassland like Goldhanger.
